name: Days Inn Winona

reviews.text: Upon entering the lobby we were greeted by the most cheerful, smiling young lady you could ever want to meet. There were more in our party than originally reserved, but she accommodated us quickly and pleasently. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the breakfast excellent, and check out staff as friendly as check in. The next night we were in a different state in a different chain motel that paled in comparison. I travel Winona several times a year highly recommend Days Inn on Cottonwood.
reviews.title: I'll stay there again, in a heartbeat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, affordable, great location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a great deal for parents of area college students—kind of a punch card.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff!

reviews.text: Had several instances of at least 3 different front desk staff coming across as rude! One lady mouthed "shut up" to a gentlemen for laughing to load. Another upon check out, gave me fits on changing the credit card I reserved to room on initially. Also, be aware that they charge your credit card immediately on check-in.
reviews.title: Front Desk Staff Extremely Rude!!

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel whenever I visit Winona. It is reasonably priced, the staff are helpful and pleasant and the accomodations are always in good order.
reviews.title: Great stay - as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my last visit (November 25, 2010) I found a little bag with a number of snack goodies in the room. It was a nice touch and appreciated.
reviews.title: Can't be beat cost, cleanliness, and friendly service.

reviews.text: Overall, a very pleasant experience. I'll mention the pros and and one con (which I wouldn't normally mention, but since it's fresh in my mind I will.)
reviews.title: Would have been GREAT, but ...

reviews.text: The Good: Good price. Nice, clean room. Well-maintained property. Breakfast was free and included made-to-order waffles. Close to several restaurants including the Ground Round, Mango's (very good Mexican food). It's on the outskirts of Winona, but just a few minutes to the downtown area, Winona State campus, etc.)
reviews.title: So much more than I expected!
Good value for money
reviews.text: The Not-so-Good: Got a room on Priceline. Knew going into it that it was for a single room, but called in advance to request double queen room. Upcharged $20 per night when I was told it would be only $10 (not only by the person on the phone, but the person who checked us in). At check out, hotel manager not willing to budge and was somewhat condescending. Charged us instead for a 3rd person (which was cheaper than the $20) ... then told me how we broke the fire code, blah, blah, blah. I guess in Minnesota you can only have two people in a double room. Doesn't quite make sense. To make a long story somewhat shorter, it's not necessarily about the money, it's just the principle of being told one thing and being told something else.

My husband booked our weekend stay via Expedia. We were visiting family in the area, didn't think we needed to book too far in advance, however lots of stuff going on in Winona July 20-22, 2012. Days Inn was the only hotel left, we got the last room. I called a couple of days prior to our arrival to see if they had a refrigerator to put in the room. We have a 10m old and I make his food and had bottles for him. When I called, I was informed my husband had booked a 1 Queen bed room, we also have an 8yr old. The staff member said we would be violating the fire code, but then found us a 2Q room :)
reviews.title: Rating based on the rude staff

reviews.text: I called to say we would not be checking in until 7pm, she assured us our room would be waiting and they had the fridge in there and it was cooling down for us.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean rooms, reasonable rates, and helpful staff made our stay pleasurable. We were on our yearly visit with stops at the Marine Musuem (art trekkies, don't miss this), an architectural hike (downtown banks are Prairie Style heaven), and good restaurants around town. You won't find a lot of add-on amenities here, but for the value, who cares? There is a complimentary breakfast to start the day and free wifi. Refrigerators are available for an extra fee. Will stay here again, for the value, for the convenience.
reviews.title: Good value, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're not needing a pool, and want a room that's always pleasing, this is your best bet in Winona. We stay in Winona fairly often due to family in the area. This time it was a class reunion. This is always our choice when we're going to be mostly just sleeping (i.e. not wanting to hang out in a pool or hot tub - why pay for those when you can't use them?). This time we discovered the Ground Round next door a few yards across the parking lot - great cozy bar, open late (not always true in Winona), and cheerful, friendly staff there too. The free breakfast in the morning is just right, with enough choices even for those of us trying to watch our calories and carbs - love waffles but trying to be good. In summary - nothing but positive thoughts about this place and we'll be back often.
reviews.title: Always pleasant and a good price

reviews.text: We stayed here when we came to watch our daughter's performance in "King Lear" at the Great River Shakespeare Festival. This was our first experience with Winona, MN and we were so pleased with our stay at this Days Inn. The rooms were large, very clean, and the beds extremely comfortable. Service was great and the breakfast was just an added benefit.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay -- we would DEFINITELY STAY AGAIN

reviews.text: We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Winona, MN area.
reviews.title: Can't wait to stay again when I visit my Daughter!

reviews.text: I have stayed at Days Inn elsewhere and have loved it! Glad there's a Days Inn in Winona where my daughter will be attending college. It's reasonably priced, lovely rooms and the complimentary breakfast is so worth it!!
reviews.title: THEY MADE ME FEEL RIGHT AT HOME

reviews.text: This place is simple. The staff was so nice and helpful. The rooms are small but very clean. My Daughter and I were there for New Student Orientation at St Mary's and just need a place to sleep. I would recomend, if you aren't looking for spacious and extras. We will definately be back.
reviews.title: worth the value

reviews.text: As a person with allergies it is great to find a No Pets Allowed motel! The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the breakfast area was good. An added plus - a short walk across the parking lot to a good restaurant.
reviews.title: Yeah - No Pets Allowed

reviews.text: For the past 4 years I have been in and out of Winona a couple of times a year and this is my first stay at DI.
reviews.title: Wow - not what I expected (in a good way)

reviews.text: I arrived very early and the desk clerk was so friendly and accommodating!
reviews.title: Yuck.

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of their apartment - we were in town for graduation and needed a place for family to gather. I stayed in a single room. Pleasantly surprised - very clean. It had a queen bed and a comfy chair with an ottoman.
reviews.title: GREAT

description: A complimentary Continental breakfast is served each morning. Days Inn Winona also offers a fitness facility, wireless Internet access, and conference rooms. Onsite parking is complimentary.
